thread.title: CycleBar opening at Polaris after lining up another Central Ohio franchisee
thread.title_full: CycleBar opening at Polaris after lining up another Central Ohio franchisee

author: Laura Newpoff
title: CycleBar opening at Polaris after lining up another Central Ohio franchisee
text: Courtesy of Cycle Bar It's full speed ahead for CycleBar in Central Ohio. The Cincinnati-based cycling franchise has inked another deal to bring its third studio to the market, this time in the Polaris area. The CycleBar theater. Courtesy of Cycle Bar Westerville residents Danielle King and Doug King will open a CycleBar this spring at 661 Worthington Road in the Westar Retail Center. Two other local franchisees have opened studios at Easton and in Powell . "I have always loved indoor cycling and became intrigued by the CycleBar concept when a friend opened the first studio in Cincinnati last year," Danielle King said in a release. The Polaris studio will have 50 bikes in its CycleTheatre. The company offers customers cycling shoes, water bottles, hydration stations, showers, fresh towels and hair and body products. There's also CycleGiving, a program offered by the studios for nonprofits to raise money by hosing private classes. You can find more information here . As our sister paper in Cincinnati reports, the company is opening hundreds of locations across the country . Laura Newpoff co-directs daily online coverage for Columbus Business First.
